author: Jessica
excerpt: We had the most full fun holiday week ever! I can’t believe how fast it went. Monday we spent time with cousins and friends!! Cutest!! These 3 were in the funniest mood ever. Jordan really felt like a “big kid” all holiday long. My heart!! Christmas eve cinnamon rolls. And christmas cheese! Then it was […]
text: We had the most full fun holiday week ever! I can’t believe how fast it went. Monday we spent time with cousins and friends!! Cutest!! These 3 were in the funniest mood ever. Jordan really felt like a “big kid” all holiday long. My heart!! Christmas eve cinnamon rolls. And christmas cheese! Then it was time for the festivities! It was soooo dark on christmas eve. I swear it was dark by 3PM! Baby Lucy! Trying to get a pic with all the kids like… PJ time! Another attempt, haha. Then it was home for Santa! Jordy fell asleep in the car but these 2 couldn’t be stopped. Emilia wanted to put out 9 large carrots. 6am when Jordan woke up the whole house! This girl is SO SWEET. The minute she realized it was christmas morning, she ran upstairs and got these bags that she made for everyone. Full of little gifts she found around the house. She was so proud. Max had to read the Santa letter because it made Eddie cry. Hehehehe. Soon after it was brunch time. We had brunch and dinner at our house! I’ve never hosted anything for christmas before, so this was all a first. We had a big brunch spread. Holiday ice cubes of course. Then later for dinner we did loaded potato soup and salad. This was such a fun change from all of the holiday food. Baby Lucy is so edible. Max had some hockey camps. And we lounged a bit… And played with allll the toys. Later in the week we went to ride the mall train. My life! I mean, this one was running wild. And then we took Jordan ice skating for the first time! Little BFFs. It was the perfect day because it was like 50 degrees! Warm enough for Max to wear a t-shirt. Don’t tell anyone he owns a coat!!! Then lunch. Then this weekend we had more christmas fun with cousins!! Look at that hair. Think they are related?! This time we did a big belgian waffle bar. The kids LOVED this. And we had a bunch of savory options too. Plus hot honey and jalapeños! Everyone opened more presents… And put on lots of makeup. Then Max and Eddie went to the pens game! We had such a full amazing week that I can’t believe it’s over already. Everything was so special and fun. I already miss this time as it passes. I wish I could freeze time!
html:
We had the most full fun holiday week ever!

I can’t believe how fast it went.

Monday we spent time with cousins and friends!!

Cutest!!

These 3 were in the funniest mood ever.

Jordan really felt like a “big kid” all holiday long.

My heart!!

Christmas eve cinnamon rolls.

And christmas cheese!

Then it was time for the festivities!

It was soooo dark on christmas eve. I swear it was dark by 3PM!

Baby Lucy!

Trying to get a pic with all the kids like…

PJ time!

Another attempt, haha.

Then it was home for Santa!

Jordy fell asleep in the car but these 2 couldn’t be stopped. Emilia wanted to put out 9 large carrots.

6am when Jordan woke up the whole house!

This girl is SO SWEET. The minute she realized it was christmas morning, she ran upstairs and got these bags that she made for everyone. Full of little gifts she found around the house. She was so proud.

Max had to read the Santa letter because it made Eddie cry. Hehehehe.

Soon after it was brunch time.

We had brunch and dinner at our house! I’ve never hosted anything for christmas before, so this was all a first.

We had a big brunch spread.

Holiday ice cubes of course.

Then later for dinner we did loaded potato soup and salad. This was such a fun change from all of the holiday food.

Baby Lucy is so edible.

Max had some hockey camps.

And we lounged a bit…

And played with allll the toys.

Later in the week we went to ride the mall train.

My life!

I mean, this one was running wild.

And then we took Jordan ice skating for the first time!

Little BFFs.

It was the perfect day because it was like 50 degrees!

Warm enough for Max to wear a t-shirt. Don’t tell anyone he owns a coat!!!

Then lunch.

Then this weekend we had more christmas fun with cousins!!

Look at that hair. Think they are related?!

This time we did a big belgian waffle bar.

The kids LOVED this.

And we had a bunch of savory options too.

Plus hot honey and jalapeños!

Everyone opened more presents…

And put on lots of makeup.

Then Max and Eddie went to the pens game!

We had such a full amazing week that I can’t believe it’s over already. Everything was so special and fun. I already miss this time as it passes. I wish I could freeze time!
